metadata.name: adj forms (i/na unified where possible)
metadata.description: Core adjective morphology and high-frequency derivational suffixes. Uses [adj] when a form applies productively to both i-adj and na-adj (with class-specific stem handling as needed). When forms differ, i/na variants are adjacent. Negative copula results (じゃない / ではない) are treated as i-adj because they enter the i-adj inflection pipeline. Some entries include second-order productive morphology (e.g., verb-conditionals applied to derivational verbs like すぎる); these are included when the derived form is productive and high-frequency.

schema.label: Resulting Class
schema.description: Primary grammatical class or functional role the pattern results in after application. Used for parsing, UI grouping, and generation logic.

values.i-adj: Inflects using i-adjective morphology (〜くない, 〜かった, 〜ければ, etc.).
values.na-adj: Behaves like a na-adjective; typically requires な before nouns and copula forms in predicates.
values.noun: Nominalized form functioning as a noun (can take particles, be modified, etc.).
values.verb: Derives or results in a verb phrase that conjugates with verb morphology.
values.adverb: Functions adverbially; modifies verbs or clauses.
values.clause: Results in a full predicate or conditional clause rather than a single lexical class.
values.other: Fallback for rare or mixed behaviors not cleanly fitting the above.

notes: Dictionary/plain form used attributively (高い本) and predicatively (高い).
Requires な before nouns (静かな部屋). Predicative typically uses copula (静かだ/です).
Past form of i-adj (高かった).
Past copula for na-adj predicates (静かだった). Morphologically a copula past clause-ending form.
Conditional built from past (〜たら). Often used for ‘if it turns out ~’ or after-the-fact conditions.
Conditional built from copula past (〜だったら).
Adverb form: 早く、上手く. Also used in set expressions and some verb-like derivations (〜くなる/〜くする).
Adverb form: 静かに、便利に. Also used for 〜になる/〜にする.
Links clauses (AくてB) and can express reason/cause.
Common in explanations and soft lead-ins (暑くて…すみません).
Connective form for na-adj predicates (静かで、便利で). Also used for nouns (学生で).
Negative i-adj (高くない). Conjugates further (高くなかった, 高くなければ).
Negative copula; treated as i-adj for further inflection (じゃなかった / じゃなければ).
Colloquial; formal counterpart is ではない.
More formal/written counterpart to じゃない.
Inflects like i-adj: ではなかった / ではなければ / ではなかったら.
Past negative i-adj (高くなかった).
Past of じゃない; continues i-adj-like inflection behavior.
Formal/written past negative copula.
Conditional on past negative (〜なかったら).
Conditional on past negative copula (colloquial).
More formal/written variant of the same conditional.
Negative conditional (〜なければ). Often used for obligations as part of set patterns (〜なければならない).
Negative conditional built from じゃない (colloquial).
Formal/written variant; common in writing and formal speech.
Standard i-adj conditional (高ければ).
Assumption/topic-based conditional (静かなら).
Often implies ‘given that/if that’s the case’ rather than purely logical ‘if’.
Nominalizes degree/quality (高さ, 便利さ).
More freely productive with i-adj; with na-adj usage is common but not equally natural for every word.
Derives a verb meaning ‘exceed; be too ~’.
Stem handling differs: i-adj drop い (高い→高すぎる); na-adj attach directly (静か→静かすぎる).
Second-order: conditional on derived verb すぎる (すぎたら). Included because productive and common.
Second-order: なら applied to the derived verb phrase すぎる. Included as a productive high-frequency frame.
Visual/appearance-based inference (おいしそう).
Stem handling differs: i-adj drop い (高い→高そう); na-adj attach directly (静か→静かそう).
Not the hearsay pattern そうだ (『〜そうだ』 meaning ‘I heard that…’).
Second-order: past/conditional built on 〜そう (そうだったら). Included as productive but less core than base そう.
Second-order: conditional built on 〜そう (そうなら). Often used when taking the appearance as a premise.
Means ‘somewhat / on the ~ side’ (高め, 早め).
Productive but not for every adjective; common in casual speech and specs (温度は高め).
Often lexicalized/limited set (苦み, 甘み, 弱み, 強み).
Tends to express an experiential/subjective ‘feel’ rather than an abstract measure.
Typically used for observable behavior, often 3rd person (子どもは怖がっている).
Common with emotion/sensation adjectives (怖い, 嫌だ/嫌い, うれしい etc.; some are irregular/lexical).
Means ‘somewhat / slightly / tending toward’ (疲れ気味, 太り気味).
Often attaches to nouns/verb stems in addition to adjectives; kept here as a high-frequency adjectival-like derivation.
Change of state from i-adj: 暑くなる, 安くなる.
Change of state from na-adj: 静かになる, 便利になる.
Cause/make change from i-adj: 安くする, 速くする.
Cause/make change or choose a state: 静かにする, 便利にする, これにする.
Inference/similarity: 雨が降るようだ.
Can modify nouns with ような and take adverbial ように; broadly behaves like a na-adj-like expression.
Na-adj requires な before ようだ in attributive linkage (静かなようだ).
Casual counterpart to ようだ; also used as みたいな / みたいに.
Commonly no な (静かみたい). Used as みたいな / みたいに for attribution/adverbial use.
